From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

Catalan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Inherited from Old Catalan morir, from Latin morīrī, variant of morī.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): (Central, Balearic) [muˈɾi]
  • IPA(key): (Valencia) [moˈɾiɾ]
  • Audio (Catalonia):(file)
  • Rhymes: -i(ɾ)

Verb

[edit]

morir (first-person singular present moro, first-person singular preterite morí, past participle mort); root stress: (Central, Valencia, Balearic) /ɔ/

  1. to die

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of morir (third conjugation, without -eix-, irregular)
infinitive morir
gerund morint
past participle masculine feminine
singular mort morta
plural morts mortes
person singular plural
first second third first second third
indicative jo tu ell/ella
vostè 		nosaltres
nós 		vosaltres
vós 		ells/elles
vostès
present moro mors mor morim moriu moren
imperfect moria mories moria moríem moríeu morien
future moriré moriràs morirà morirem morireu moriran
preterite morí morires morí morírem moríreu moriren
conditional moriria moriries moriria moriríem moriríeu moririen
subjunctive jo tu ell/ella
vostè 		nosaltres
nós 		vosaltres
vós 		ells/elles
vostès
present mori moris mori morim moriu morin
imperfect morís morissis morís moríssim moríssiu morissin
imperative — tu vostè nosaltres vosaltres
vós 		vostès
affirmative — mor mori morim moriu morin
negative (no) — no moris no mori no morim no moriu no morin

Related terms

[edit]
  • mort

Further reading

[edit]
  • “morir”, in Diccionari de la llengua catalana [Dictionary of the Catalan Language] (in Catalan), second edition, Institute of Catalan Studies [Catalan: Institut d'Estudis Catalans], April 2007
  • “morir”, in Gran Diccionari de la Llengua Catalana, Grup Enciclopèdia Catalana, 2025
  • “morir” in Diccionari normatiu valencià, Acadèmia Valenciana de la Llengua.
  • “morir” in Diccionari català-valencià-balear, Antoni Maria Alcover and Francesc de Borja Moll, 1962.

Franco-Provençal

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Inherited from Latin morī(rī).

Verb

[edit]

morir (ORB, broad)

  1. to die
    Antonym: vivre

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of morir
simple compound
infinitive morir étre môrt
gerund morent étent môrt
auxiliary verb étre
past participle masculine feminine

plural [Term?] [Term?]

past anterior preterite indicative of étre + past participle

compound tenses past present subjunctive of étre + past participle

References

[edit]
  • mourir in DicoFranPro: Dictionnaire Français/Francoprovençal – on dicofranpro.llm.umontreal.ca
  • morir in Lo trèsor Arpitan – on arpitan.eu

[edit]

Italian

[edit]

Verb

[edit]

morir (apocopated)

  1. apocopic form of morire

Ladin

[edit]

Alternative forms

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Inherited from Latin morīrī, variant of morī.

Verb

[edit]

morir

  1. to die

[edit]

Ladino

[edit]

Verb

[edit]

morir (Hebrew spelling מוריר)[1]

  1. alternative form of murir

References

[edit]

Occitan

[edit]

Alternative forms

[edit]
  • mourir (Mistralian spelling)

Etymology

[edit]

Inherited from Old Occitan morir, from Latin morīrī, variant of morī.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /muˈɾi/
  • Audio (Béarn):(file)

Verb

[edit]

morir

  1. to die

Conjugation

[edit]

This verb needs an inflection-table template.

Related terms

[edit]
  • mort

Old French

[edit]

Alternative forms

[edit]
  • murir

Etymology

[edit]

Inherited from Latin morīrī, variant of morī. The sense of "to kill" may have been back-formed from the Latin ancestor's deponent nature.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /muˈɾiɾ/

Verb

[edit]

morir

  1. (intransitive) to die
    • c. 1250, Marie de France, Guigemar:
      Kar ne se volt laissier murir
      Because he didn't want to let himself die
  2. (transitive, rare, takes avoir as an auxiliary) to kill
    • 12th Century, Unknown, Raoul de Cambrai:
      Se l'avés mort il m'en poise forment.
      If you have killed him, it will bother me greatly.

Conjugation

[edit]

This verb conjugates as a third-group verb. This verb has a stressed present stem muer distinct from the unstressed stem mor, as well as other irregularities. Old French conjugation varies significantly by date and by region. The following conjugation should be treated as a guide.

    Conjugation of morir (see also Appendix:Old French verbs)
simple compound
infinitive morir estre mort
gerund en morant gerund of estre + past participle
present participle morant
past participle mort
person singular plural
first second third first second third
indicative jo tu il nos vos il
simple
tenses 		present muir muers muert morons morez muerent
imperfect moroie, moreie moroies, moreies moroit, moreit moriiens, moriens moriiez, moriez moroient, moreient
preterite morui, mori morus, moris moru, mori morumes, morimes morustes, moristes morurent, morirent
future morrai morras morra morrons morroiz, morreiz, morrez morront
conditional morroie, morreie morroies, morreies morroit, morreit morriiens, morriens morriiez, morriez morroient, morreient
compound
tenses 		present perfect present tense of estre + past participle
pluperfect imperfect tense of estre + past participle
past anterior preterite tense of estre + past participle
future perfect future tense of estre + past participle
conditional perfect conditional tense of estre + past participle
subjunctive que jo que tu qu’il que nos que vos qu’il
simple
tenses 		present muire, muere, muerge muires, mueres, muerges muire, muere, muerge morons, muiriens, muirons, muerons, muergiens, muerjons morez, muiriez, muerez, muergiez muirent, muerent, muergent
imperfect morusse, morisse morusses, morisses morust, morist morussons, morussiens, morissons, morissiens morussoiz, morussez, morussiez, morissoiz, morissez, morissiez morussent, morissent
compound

— muir — morons morez —

Related terms

[edit]
  • mort

Descendants

[edit]
  • Middle French: mourir
    • French: mourir
      • Haitian Creole: mouri
      • Louisiana Creole: mouri
  • Norman: mouorir (Guernsey), mouothi (Jersey)
  • Picard: moérir
  • Walloon: mori

Old Spanish

[edit]

Alternative forms

[edit]
  • murir

Etymology

[edit]

Inherited from Latin morīrī, variant of morī. Cognate with Old Galician-Portuguese morrer, morer and Old French morir, murir.

Verb

[edit]

morir

  1. (intransitive) to die; to pass away (cease living)
    Antonym: bevir
    • c. 1200, Almerich, Fazienda de Ultramar, f. 54r:
      dixo ẏſaẏas a los menſageros q̃l embio el reẏ ezechias aſſi dizredes al nr̃o ſennor q̃ diz el criador Nõ temas delas menazas q̃ oiſt de los uaſſallos del reẏ de ſur. Afe yo trametre uiẽto ⁊ oyra tal palabra. por q̃stornara aſu tr̃a ⁊ ẏl fara morir aeſpada.
      Isaiah said the messengers sent to him by king Hezekiah, “You will tell our master that thus says the Creator, ‘Do not fear the threats you have heard from the servants of the king of the south. Lo, I will send wind and he will hear a rumor such that he will return to his land, and there he will be made to die by the sword.’”

Descendants

[edit]
  • Ladino: morir, murir, מוריר
  • Spanish: morir

References

[edit]
  • Ralph Steele Boggs et al. (1946), “morir”, in Tentative Dictionary of Medieval Spanish, volume II, Chapel Hill, page 349

Spanish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Inherited from Old Spanish murir, morir, from Latin morīrī, variant of morī. Cognate with Galician morrer, Ladino murir, and Portuguese morrer. Compare English mortify.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /moˈɾiɾ/ [moˈɾiɾ]
  • Audio:(file)
  • Rhymes: -iɾ
  • Syllabification: mo‧rir

Verb

[edit]

morir (first-person singular present muero, first-person singular preterite morí, past participle muerto)

  1. (intransitive, sometimes reflexive) to die
    Synonyms: estirar la pata, fallecer, morirse, palmar, petatearse
    Antonym: vivir
    La caballerosidad no ha muerto.
    Chivalry isn't dead.
  2. (intransitive, reflexive, idiomatic) to be dying (for, to)

Usage notes

[edit]
  • The reflexive form of this verb, morirse, is more informal, while the non-reflexive form, morir, is more formal.
  • Widely used figuratively, as in English:
    • Me morí del aburrimiento ― I died of boredom
    • Me morí del susto ― I died of fright

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of morir (irregular; o-ue-u alternation) (See Appendix:Spanish verbs)
infinitive morir
gerund muriendo
past participle masculine feminine
singular muerto muerta
plural muertos muertas

vosotras 		ellos/ellas

2Argentine and Uruguayan voseo prefers the tú form for the present subjunctive.

These forms are generated automatically and may not actually be used. Pronoun usage varies by region.

Derived terms

[edit]
  • bicho malo nunca muere
  • de casi no se muere nadie
  • el lobo muere lobo
  • la esperanza es la última que muere
  • morir de hambre
  • morir de risa
  • morir de sed
  • morirse de risa
  • por la boca muere el pez
  • quien a hierro mata, a hierro muere
  • tanto nadar para morir en la orilla

Related terms

[edit]
  • moribundo
  • mortal
  • muerte
  • muerto

Further reading

[edit]
  • “morir”, in Diccionario de la lengua española [Dictionary of the Spanish Language] (in Spanish), online version 23.8, Royal Spanish Academy [Spanish: Real Academia Española], 10 December 2024

Venetan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Inherited from Latin morīrī, variant of morī.

Verb

[edit]

morir

  1. (intransitive) to die

Conjugation

[edit]

* Venetan conjugation varies from one region to another. Hence, the following conjugation should be considered as typical, not as exhaustive.

Conjugation of morir (third conjugation, irregular past participle)
infinitive morir
auxiliary verb èser gerund moréndo
past participle morto
person singular plural
first second third first second third
indicative mi ti eło / eła noialtri / noialtre voialtri / voialtre łuri / łore
present moriso (te) morisi (el/ła) morise morimo morì (i/łe) morise
imperfect morìa (te) morivi (el/ła) morìa morìvimo morivi (i/łe) morìa
future morirò (te) morirè (el/ła) morirà morirémo morirè (i/łe) morirà
conditional morirìa (te) moririsi (el/ła) morirìa morirìsimo moririsi (i/łe) morirìa
subjunctive che mi che ti che eło / eła che noialtri / noialtre che voialtri / voialtre che łuri / łore
present morisa (te) morisi (el/ła) morisa morimo morì (i/łe) morisa
imperfect morise (te) morisi (el/ła) morise morisimo morisi (i/łe) morise
imperative — ti eło / eła noialtri / noialtre voialtri / voialtre łuri / łore
— (te) morisi (el/ła) morisa morimo morì (i/łe) morisa
